### 1. Nh√¢n b·∫£n kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ ZipVoice

translatedContent: ### 3 H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n s·ª≠ d·ª•ng t·ªët h∆°n:

Ch√∫ng t√¥i khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã s·ª≠ d·ª•ng file wav l·ªùi nh·∫Øc ng·∫Øn (v√≠ d·ª•, d∆∞·ªõi 3 gi√¢y cho t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i m·ªôt ng∆∞·ªùi, d∆∞·ªõi 10 gi√¢y cho t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i h·ªôi tho·∫°i) ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô suy lu·∫≠n. L·ªùi nh·∫Øc qu√° d√†i s·∫Ω l√†m ch·∫≠m qu√° tr√¨nh suy lu·∫≠n v√† gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng ti·∫øng n√≥i.

originContent: We recommand a short prompt wav file (e.g., less than 3 seconds for single-speaker speech generation, less than 10 seconds for dialogue speech generation) for faster inference speed. A very long prompt will slow down the inference and degenerate the speech quality.

translatedContent: N·∫øu t·ªëc ƒë·ªô suy lu·∫≠n kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc nh∆∞ sau:

originContent: If the inference speed is unsatisfactory, you can speed it up as follows:

translatedContent: - **M√¥ h√¨nh distill v√† gi·∫£m b∆∞·ªõc**: ƒê·ªëi v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i m·ªôt ng∆∞·ªùi, ch√∫ng t√¥i s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh `zipvoice` m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng ti·∫øng n√≥i t·ªët h∆°n. N·∫øu ∆∞u ti√™n t·ªëc ƒë·ªô, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn sang `zipvoice_distill` v√† gi·∫£m `--num-steps` xu·ªëng th·∫•p nh·∫•t l√† `4` (m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh l√† 8).

originContent: - **Distill model and less steps**: For the single-speaker speech generation model, we use the `zipvoice` model by default for better speech quality. If faster speed is a priority, you can switch to the `zipvoice_distill` and can reduce the `--num-steps` to as low as `4` (8 by default).

translatedContent: - **TƒÉng t·ªëc CPU v·ªõi ƒëa lu·ªìng**: Khi ch·∫°y tr√™n CPU, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ truy·ªÅn tham s·ªë `--num-thread` (v√≠ d·ª•, `--num-thread 4`) ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng lu·ªìng nh·∫±m tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô. M·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh l√† 1 lu·ªìng.

originContent: - **CPU speedup with multi-threading**: When running on CPU, you can pass the `--num-thread` parameter (e.g., `--num-thread 4`) to increase the number of threads for faster speed. We use 1 thread by default.

translatedContent: - **TƒÉng t·ªëc CPU v·ªõi ONNX**: Khi ch·∫°y tr√™n CPU, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ONNX v·ªõi `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc (hi·ªán ch∆∞a h·ªó tr·ª£ ONNX cho m√¥ h√¨nh t·∫°o h·ªôi tho·∫°i). ƒê·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc h∆°n n·ªØa, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·∫∑t `--onnx-int8 True` ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ONNX ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ h√≥a INT8. L∆∞u √Ω r·∫±ng m√¥ h√¨nh l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ h√≥a s·∫Ω l√†m gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng ti·∫øng n√≥i ·ªü m·ªôt m·ª©c ƒë·ªô nh·∫•t ƒë·ªãnh. **Kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ONNX tr√™n GPU**, v√¨ n√≥ ch·∫≠m h∆°n PyTorch tr√™n GPU.

originContent: - **CPU speedup with ONNX**: When running on CPU, you can use ONNX models with `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` for faster speed (haven't supported ONNX for dialogue generation models yet). For even faster speed, you can further set `--onnx-int8 True` to use an INT8-quantized ONNX model. Note that the quantized model will result in a certain degree of speech quality degradation. **Don't use ONNX on GPU**, as it is slower than PyTorch on GPU.

translatedContent: VƒÉn b·∫£n ƒë·∫ßu v√†o s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c chia th√†nh t·ª´ng ƒëo·∫°n d·ª±a tr√™n d·∫•u c√¢u (cho t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i m·ªôt ng∆∞·ªùi) ho·∫∑c k√Ω hi·ªáu chuy·ªÉn ng∆∞·ªùi n√≥i (cho t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i h·ªôi tho·∫°i). Sau ƒë√≥, c√°c ƒëo·∫°n vƒÉn b·∫£n n√†y s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c x·ª≠ l√Ω theo l√¥. Do ƒë√≥, m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω vƒÉn b·∫£n d√†i t√πy √Ω v·ªõi m·ª©c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng b·ªô nh·ªõ g·∫ßn nh∆∞ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªïi. B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ ki·ªÉm so√°t b·ªô nh·ªõ b·∫±ng c√°ch ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh tham s·ªë `--max-duration`.

originContent: The given text will be splitted into chunks based on punctuation (for single-speaker speech generation) or speaker-turn symbol (for dialogue speech generation). Then, the chunked texts will be processed in batches. Therefore, the model can process arbitrarily long text with almost constant memory usage. You can control memory usage by adjusting the `--max-duration` parameter.

translatedContent: Theo m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh, ch√∫ng t√¥i ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω c√°c ƒë·∫ßu v√†o (file wav l·ªùi nh·∫Øc, b·∫£n ghi l·ªùi nh·∫Øc, v√† vƒÉn b·∫£n) ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a suy lu·∫≠n v√† n√¢ng cao hi·ªáu nƒÉng. N·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën ƒë√°nh gi√° hi·ªáu nƒÉng "raw" c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi c√°c ƒë·∫ßu v√†o ch√≠nh x√°c ƒë∆∞·ª£c cung c·∫•p (v√≠ d·ª•, ƒë·ªÉ t√°i t·∫°o k·∫øt qu·∫£ trong b√†i b√°o c·ªßa ch√∫ng t√¥i), b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ truy·ªÅn `--raw-evaluation True`.

originContent: By default, we preprocess inputs (prompt wav, prompt transcription, and text) for efficient inference and better performance. If you want to evaluate the model‚Äôs "raw" performance using exact provided inputs (e.g., to reproduce the results in our paper), you can pass `--raw-evaluation True`.

translatedContent: Khi t·∫°o ti·∫øng n√≥i cho c√°c vƒÉn b·∫£n r·∫•t ng·∫Øn (v√≠ d·ª•, m·ªôt ho·∫∑c hai t·ª´), ti·∫øng n√≥i t·∫°o ra ƒë√¥i khi c√≥ th·ªÉ b·ªè s√≥t m·ªôt s·ªë ph√°t √¢m. ƒê·ªÉ kh·∫Øc ph·ª•c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ n√†y, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ truy·ªÅn `--speed 0.3` (trong ƒë√≥ 0.3 l√† gi√° tr·ªã c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh) ƒë·ªÉ k√©o d√†i th·ªùi l∆∞·ª£ng ti·∫øng n√≥i t·∫°o ra.

originContent: When generating speech for very short texts (e.g., one or two words), the generated speech may sometimes omit certain pronunciations. To resolve this issue, you can pass `--speed 0.3` (where 0.3 is a tunable value) to extend the duration of the generated speech.

translatedContent: #### 3.6 S·ª≠a l·ªói ph√°t √¢m k√Ω t·ª± ƒëa √¢m ti·∫øng Trung

Ch√∫ng t√¥i s·ª≠ d·ª•ng [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi k√Ω t·ª± ti·∫øng Trung sang pinyin. Tuy nhi√™n, ƒë√¥i khi n√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√°t √¢m sai **k√Ω t·ª± ƒëa √¢m** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).

originContent: We use [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) to convert Chinese characters to pinyin. However, it can occasionally mispronounce **polyphone characters** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).
To manually correct these mispronunciations, enclose the **corrected pinyin** in angle brackets `< >` and include the **tone mark**.
translatedContent: ƒê·ªÉ ch·ªânh s·ª≠a th·ªß c√¥ng c√°c l·ªói ph√°t √¢m n√†y, h√£y ƒë·∫∑t **pinyin ƒë√£ ch·ªânh s·ª≠a** trong d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c nh·ªçn `< >` v√† bao g·ªìm **d·∫•u thanh**.

originContent: > **Note:** If you want to manually assign multiple pinyins, enclose each pinyin with `<>`, e.g., `ËøôÊää<jian4><chang2><san1>ÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`
translatedContent: > **L∆∞u √Ω:** N·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën g√°n nhi·ªÅu pinyin th·ªß c√¥ng, h√£y ƒë·∫∑t m·ªói pinyin trong d·∫•u `<>`, v√≠ d·ª•: `ËøôÊää<jian4><chang2><san1>ÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`

originContent: #### 3.7 Remove long silences from the generated speech
translatedContent: #### 3.7 Lo·∫°i b·ªè kho·∫£ng l·∫∑ng d√†i trong ti·∫øng n√≥i ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫°o ra

originContent: Model will automatically determine the positions and lengths of silences in the generated speech. It occasionally has long silence in the middle of the speech. If you don't want this, you can pass `--remove-long-sil` to remove long silences in the middle of the generated speech (edge silences will be removed by default).
translatedContent: M√¥ h√¨nh s·∫Ω t·ª± ƒë·ªông x√°c ƒë·ªãnh v·ªã tr√≠ v√† ƒë·ªô d√†i c·ªßa kho·∫£ng l·∫∑ng trong ti·∫øng n√≥i ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫°o ra. ƒê√¥i khi c√≥ kho·∫£ng l·∫∑ng d√†i ·ªü gi·ªØa ƒëo·∫°n n√≥i. N·∫øu b·∫°n kh√¥ng mu·ªën ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ th√™m t√πy ch·ªçn `--remove-long-sil` ƒë·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè kho·∫£ng l·∫∑ng d√†i ·ªü gi·ªØa ƒëo·∫°n n√≥i (kho·∫£ng l·∫∑ng ·ªü hai ƒë·∫ßu s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c lo·∫°i b·ªè m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh).

originContent: If you have trouble connecting to HuggingFace when downloading the pre-trained models, try switching endpoint to the mirror site: `export HF_ENDPOINT=https://hf-mirror.com`.
